page.title: 11 OLD HOUSES IN MYDDLE
page.content:
Probably the {Oldest House}in {Myddle} is named {'Tilers Cottage'.}It is a black and white cottage with 2 floors, and is about 400 years old. It was mentioned in {Richard Goughs 'History {of Myddle'}which was written in the 17th century.
Another {Old House}is named {'The Old {Rectory'}which is near the church.It was built in the 19th century and has a large area of ground.
{'The Groves'}is another black and white house,which is built of stone and is situated just out of {Myddle.} It was built around 1815 and has 2 storeys.
